title: Aluminum Falls After China Restricts HF Trading
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK fell below $3,140 per tonne, retreating from an over three-year high hit on January 13th after China tightened restrictions on high-frequency trading. Chinese regulators ordered mainland exchanges to remove servers operated by high-frequency traders from their data centres. Over the past month, aluminum prices have risen 6.68%, up 18.38% from the same time last year.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum fell to 3,139.40 USD/T on January 20, 2026, down 0.85% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 6.68% and are up 18.38% compared to the same time last year. The price was last updated on January 20, 2026.

title: Tariff Talk, Safe-Haven Walk - Daily Base Metals Analysis
summary: Aluminium spreads eased back into contango, while the metal slipped below support at $3,110/t to settle near $3,099/t. This reflects ongoing market adjustments amid tariff discussions and safe-haven flows. Lead also breached key levels in the session.

title: China Aluminum Output at Record, Steel Below 1 Billion Tons
summary: China's aluminum production rose 2.4% to a record 45.02 million tons in 2025, with December hitting 3.87 million tons. Forecasts indicate capacity will increase by 900,000 tons through 2028, potentially leading to a larger global surplus and lower prices. This contrasts with steel output declining 4.4% to 961 million tons.

title: January 21, 2026, Jinshi Futures Morning Report: SHFE adjusts the ...
summary: China's primary aluminum production in December 2025 was estimated at 3.767 million tons, up from 3.646 million tons previously. Global primary aluminum output reached 6.296 million tons in December 2025. Rio Tinto reported 2025 aluminum production of 3.38 million tons, exceeding guidance.

title: Reviving Venezuela's Idle Aluminium Industry Challenges
summary: The article discusses strategies and investment requirements to revive Venezuela's idle aluminum industry. It highlights challenges in restarting production capacity that has been dormant.

title: Aluminum Sector 2026: Strategic Plays in a Supply-Constrained World
summary: Alcoa is positioned as a leader in the supply-constrained aluminum sector through innovations like ELYSIS™ and ASTRAEA™, alongside circular economy initiatives for low-carbon aluminum. The company has secured a 10-year renewable energy deal with NYPA and invested $60M in smelter modernization to enhance green production. These efforts align with decarbonization demands despite market challenges like bearish forecasts.

title: Aluminium's unifying approach to net-zero transformation
summary: The aluminum industry advances decarbonization via technologies like ELYSIS from Alcoa and Rio Tinto, which eliminates GHG emissions, and EGA's CelestiAL solar-powered aluminum. These innovations, combined with recycling and carbon capture, position aluminum as a sustainable metal for net-zero goals across sectors like EVs and renewables. The approach integrates clean energy, recycling revolutions, and multi-faceted strategies for industrial growth.

title: Hydro joins Alumobility to accelerate aluminium adoption in the automotive industry
summary: Hydro has joined Alumobility to promote aluminum in automotive applications for lighter, energy-efficient, and sustainable vehicles. Leveraging low-carbon production and advanced materials, Hydro contributes expertise across the aluminum lifecycle to support OEM sustainability targets. The collaboration advances innovation in lightweight, circular solutions for the sector.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Driving Innovation for a Sustainable Future
summary: The ALUMINIUM 2026 event focuses on sustainability, emphasizing secondary aluminum for decarbonization, alongside topics like recycling, primary production, and applications in mobility and construction. It serves as a platform for collaboration, innovation, and showcasing the industry's recyclability and future potential. Proven formats like themed pavilions will highlight technological advancements.

title: HRC Steel rose to 940 USD/T on January 20, 2026
summary: HRC Steel increased to 940.09 USD/T, up 0.22% from the previous day. Over the past month, HRC Steel's price has risen 3.53%, and is up 36.05% compared to the same time last year. Trading Economics forecasts HRC Steel to trade at 956.97 USD/T by the end of Q1 2026.

title: US raw steel production is up 0.2 percent - week 2, 2026
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 17, 2026, was 1.756 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 75.9%, up 0.2% from the previous week. Year-to-date production through January 17, 2026, was 4.238 million net tons, representing a 2.9% increase from the same period last year.

title: Final Thoughts - Steel Market Update
summary: Sheet steel prices climbed to new multi-month highs this week, with demand driven by data centers, energy transmission projects, and border fence construction. Extreme cold weather has reduced scrap flows, and the market has experienced a relatively calm start to 2026 without major price shocks.

title: AISI: Raw steel production rises 0.2%
summary: US domestic mill production reached 1,756,000 short tons of raw steel in the week ending January 17, 2026, up 0.2% from the previous week and 3.3% higher than the same week last year. The mill capability utilization rate was 75.9%, with year-to-date production up 2.9% compared to the same period in 2025.

title: US raw steel production is up 0.2 percent - week 2, 2026
summary: According to the American Iron and Steel Institute, US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 17, 2026, was 1.756 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 75.9%. Year-to-date adjusted production through January 17, 2026, reached 4.238 million net tons, representing a 2.9% increase from the same period last year.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is advancing with green innovations like lower-carbon electric arc mini-mills that recycle scrap, reducing reliance on coal and emissions by 37% per ton since 1990. Startups such as Hertha Metals and Electra are pioneering coal-free processes using electricity and chemical reactions, making production more efficient and cost-competitive than traditional methods or even China. Investor funding and technology improvements signal a bright future for decarbonized steelmaking amid rising production.

title: Future of Steel: Trends, Technology & Sustainability 2026
summary: The article explores upcoming trends in steel production by 2026, focusing on sustainability, scrap recycling, and new low-carbon technologies. It highlights innovations reshaping the industry to reduce emissions and improve efficiency. These advancements aim to align steelmaking with environmental goals while maintaining competitiveness.

title: Top Shipbuilding Steel Plate Supplier Responds to Rising Global Maritime Demand
summary: Steel suppliers are innovating with high-performance plates featuring advanced rolling techniques, alloys, and treatments for stronger, lighter ship structures with better corrosion resistance. Sustainability efforts include greener production processes to cut carbon emissions and meet environmental regulations in shipbuilding. Digitalization and modular construction drive demand for precision-engineered steel compatible with automation.

title: Copper Rises on Weaker Dollar
summary: Copper futures climbed above $5.9 per pound on Monday as the dollar weakened amid concerns over US President Donald Trump's tariff threats against European nations over Greenland. The market also assessed mixed economic signals from top consumer China.

title: Commodity Radar: After a 62% surge in 2025, copper's flat trade shows loss of momentum in 2026 is it a blip or trend reversal
summary: Copper prices have stalled in early 2026 after a 62% rally on the MCX in 2025, with profit booking and volatility capping gains. The market is characterized by extreme volatility following all-time highs, though fundamentals remain supported by structural supply deficits and strong demand from AI and green energy sectors.

title: Copper Price Surges to Fresh Record as Supply Fears Grip Global Markets
summary: Copper crossed the $13,000 per tonne mark for the first time, with three-month futures hitting an all-time high of $13,283 per tonne on the London Metal Exchange. The surge is driven by growing supply uncertainty, including concerns about potential US tariffs on refined copper and supply disruptions at key global mines.

title: Viewpoint: US copper faces uncertain 2026 outlook
summary: US copper prices are expected to remain volatile in 2026 due to multiple factors including Chinese demand, copper supply, and AI sector demand. Goldman Sachs forecasts copper will average $5.17/lb in 2026, while other analysts like Citigroup predict prices above $5.90/lb by the second quarter.

title: Copper prices rise amid mergers and strong demand forecasts
summary: Copper prices have rebounded as analysts predict strong demand, spurring merger activity in the mining sector.

title: BHP lifts copper guidance after record half-year output
summary: BHP upgraded its FY26 copper production guidance to 1,900–2,000 kt from 1,800–2,000 kt following strong half-year performance. The company's Escondida copper operation achieved record concentrator throughput with guidance increased to 1,200–1,275 kt. BHP management highlighted a significant copper growth pipeline targeting approximately 2 Mt of attributable copper production in the 2030s.

title: Rio Tinto copper output climbs as Oyu Tolgoi mine ramps up
summary: Rio Tinto Group's copper production climbed 5% in the fourth quarter driven by the expansion of underground operations at the Oyu Tolgoi mine. The company achieved copper equivalent production growth of 8% year-over-year in 2025, with shipments up 5%.

title: Rio Tinto reports record iron ore quarter and soaring copper production
summary: Rio Tinto exceeded Q4 production estimates with record copper output up 11%, while the Pilbara iron ore operation hit a quarterly record. The company demonstrated operational excellence across multiple commodity segments despite market pressures.

title: Rio Tinto & AWS: Partnering for Sustainable Copper Sourcing
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS are collaborating to integrate low-carbon Nuton copper technology into U.S. data centers, using bioleaching with microorganisms to extract copper from sulphide ores. This modular system produces 99.99% pure copper at the mine gate, reducing water use, emissions, and the need for traditional smelters while optimizing operations via AWS cloud analytics. The partnership enhances supply chain resilience and supports sustainable copper production for digital infrastructure.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: AWS and Rio Tinto partner to source Nuton low-carbon copper for U.S. data centers, leveraging bioleaching to shorten the supply chain and recover copper from waste ores with lower water and emissions. Cloud analytics from AWS will optimize production, aligning with demands from AI-driven cloud growth. This initiative advances ESG goals and domestic low-carbon supply chains.

title: Driving innovation at Escondida
summary: BHP is advancing safety, sustainability, and innovation at its Escondida copper mine in Chile, the world's largest producer, through autonomous operations and technology to address declining ore grades. These efforts enhance productivity, reduce risks, and support growing global copper demand from electrification and renewables. The mine's long-life resource base positions it for future sustainable production.

title: Zijin Joins International Copper Association to Advance Sustainable Copper Production
summary: Zijin Mining, the world's fourth-largest copper producer, joined the International Copper Association to promote responsible production, technological innovation, and sustainability. The membership fosters industry collaboration for the energy transition, leveraging Zijin's green mining practices and global expertise. It aims to build a resilient copper supply chain supporting low-carbon development.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS are partnering to supply low-carbon Nuton copper for U.S. data centers, utilizing innovative bioleaching technology for efficient, reduced-emission production. This collaboration combines industrial innovation with cloud technology to scale cleaner copper materials. It supports AWS's net-zero goals and strengthens sustainable supply chains.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Pulled Back on January 21, Fiscal Expenditure in 2026 to Increase Overall
summary: On January 21, SMM #1 refined nickel prices ranged from 139,800-150,000 yuan/mt, averaging 144,900 yuan/mt, down 1,450 yuan/mt from the previous day. The SHFE nickel contract (2602) closed the morning session at 140,850 yuan/mt, down 1.16%, amid battles between Indonesian policy expectations and high inventory realities. Nickel prices may hover at highs if supply cut expectations persist.

title: Nickel Industries posts Q4 earnings and lifts outlook
summary: Nickel Industries Ltd reported December quarter adjusted EBITDA from operations expected at US$35-40 million, with record quarterly EBITDA of US$129 million from its HNC HPAL operation. Ore sales at Hengjaya Mine dropped due to regulatory delays, causing US$45 million in foregone sales and US$18 million in costs, but operations resumed in mid-December with strong January sales. The company is advancing its pivot to EV battery materials.

title: Nickel Futures Retreat From Recent Highs
summary: Nickel futures retreated from recent highs amid profit-taking and softening Chinese demand. Prices slipped toward $18,000 per tonne after hitting nineteen-month peaks.

title: TRADE REVIEW: Asian nickel market faces Q1 pressure as oversupply outweighs output cuts
summary: The Asian nickel market faces Q1 2026 pressure from oversupply despite Indonesia's output cuts and supply uncertainties like Vale Indonesia's halt. Nickel ore prices declined, with high-grade at $62.5/wmt and low-grade at $40.9/wmt on Jan. 14 CIF China. New HPAL projects may add supply, but seasonal demand weakness and policy changes add downward pressure.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25,000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices hit 15-month highs over $18,500/ton in January 2026 due to Indonesia's supply management, delaying permits and cutting quotas. Much of the prior surplus was illusory, with only 55% capacity utilized in 2025. Prices could test $20,000–$22,000/t or even $25,000/t amid tightening physical balances.

title: Nickel Prices Ease as Profit-Taking Hits Market
summary: Nickel futures slipped toward $18,000 per tonne as profit-taking hit after nineteen-month highs. Chinese demand showed signs of softening, contributing to the pullback.

title: TRADE REVIEW: Asian nickel market faces Q1 pressure as oversupply outweighs output cuts
summary: The Asian nickel market faces pressure in Q1 2026 despite Indonesia's output cuts, with S&P Global projecting a surplus of 179,000 metric tons through 2026. Six new HPAL projects could add over 400,000 mt/y of nickel capacity, though rising sulfur costs may limit impact. Vale Indonesia halted mining on Jan. 2 due to delayed 2026 approvals.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Pulled Back on January 21
summary: SMM #1 refined nickel prices averaged 144,900 yuan/mt on January 21, down 1,450 yuan/mt amid high inventory and weak demand. The market balances expectations for Indonesian production cuts against current realities. SHFE nickel futures closed the morning session at 140,850 yuan/mt, down 1.16%.

title: Nickel Futures Retreat From Recent Highs
summary: Nickel futures fell toward $18,000 per tonne after hitting $18,700, with Indonesia cutting 2026 nickel ore quotas by 34% to align with processing capacity. Chinese spot prices dropped amid profit-taking and soft demand, while SHFE futures declined 1.6%. Nickel Industries reported lower ore sales but resumed shipments in early January.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25,000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices rallied to $16,500–$18,500 per ton in early January 2026 as Indonesia slashes output quotas and delays permits to support prices. Only 55% of approved capacity was utilized in 2025, deflating surplus perceptions. Indonesia bans new NPI smelters and HPAL plants to focus on downstream value.

title: Indonesian Mining Restrictions Send Shockwaves Through Global Nickel Market
summary: Nickel prices surged $2,200 per ton to $18,650 after Vale's mining permit delays in Indonesia confirmed supply constraints. This triggered restocking and price rises across nickel pig iron and stainless steel. Seasonal weakness in Philippine supply adds pressure, with prices potentially reaching $20,000 in Q1.

title: MacroAsia unit's Palawan nickel project gets MGB clearance
summary: MacroAsia Mining Corp. received approval for its Infanta nickel project in Palawan, planning to invest 12 million for extraction across 1,113 hectares. The project falls under Production Sharing No.220-5-IVB in Brooke's Point. The company anticipates nickel market recovery to enable full commercial production.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for electric vehicles and green energy. The project utilizes the innovative DNi Process, which recycles over 98% of nitric acid, requires no tailings dams, and produces minimal waste, ensuring sustainability. Once operational, it will be a carbon-negative facility supplying nickel and cobalt to the EV and energy storage industries.

title: Critical minerals: Why innovation begins beneath the Earth's surface
summary: Demand for critical minerals like nickel for clean energy technologies is projected to rise over 3.4 times by 2040 under net-zero scenarios. The article emphasizes the need for innovative, responsible mining practices to secure supplies while protecting the environment and driving economic growth. Leaders at the 2026 World Economic Forum Annual Meeting will discuss balancing mineral extraction with sustainability.

title: Nickel market set for steady growth as stainless steel and ev demand reshape supply
summary: The nickel market anticipates steady growth driven by stainless steel demand in Asia and increasing needs for battery-grade nickel in EVs. New battery-grade refineries in North America focus on lower-carbon supply chains, while sustainability pressures push for renewable energy and traceability in production. High-quality Class I nickel remains in short supply, highlighting the importance of advanced refining technologies.

title: Next-Gen Battery Chemistries Shift to Silicon and Nickel
summary: High-nickel cathodes like NMC and NCA are advancing for high-energy-density EV batteries, reducing cobalt reliance while boosting capacity. These innovations prioritize performance and sustainability but require improved thermal management. IDTechEx forecasts significant demand growth for high-nickel cathodes in Western markets by 2036.

title: Nickel and cobalt out, CO2 in at Turnagain
summary: A potential future mine at Turnagain could lock away over 200 million tons of atmospheric CO2 while innovating nickel production. The project shifts focus from traditional nickel and cobalt extraction to carbon sequestration, enhancing sustainability.

title: Digital integration boosts safety, productivity, sustainability at Anglo American Barro Alto mine
summary: Digital integration at Anglo American's Barro Alto mine, a nickel producer, enhances safety, productivity, and sustainability through advanced technologies. The project demonstrates how digitization supports responsible mining operations.

title: Axpo Italia to supply green energy to Tenaris in Italy
summary: Axpo Italia has signed a Power Purchase Agreement with Tenaris to supply 15 GWh per year of certified green energy to Tenaris's Dalmine seamless steel pipe mill in Italy. This agreement supports Tenaris's 2030 decarbonization goal and complements other sustainability initiatives including an electrolyzer project for hydrogen production and solar parks under construction.

title: Hydrogen to decarbonize steel: first trial launched in Italy - Tenaris
summary: Tenaris, Snam, and Tenova launched the first trial in Italy using hydrogen at a steel plant to process steel products at Tenaris's Dalmine mill in Bergamo. The six-month collaboration aims to evaluate hydrogen performance and reliability in steel production, using on-site hydrogen production to fuel a reheating furnace for hot rolling seamless pipes.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: Tenaris participated in the Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, showcasing its steel solutions for power generation applications. The company highlighted its 25-year partnership with Sofinter Group and its investments in high-performance tubular solutions, including specialized products like Thor® 115 steel for extreme operating conditions.

title: Italy's Prysmian ditches plan to construct U.S. plant for offshore wind parks
summary: Prysmian has abandoned its plan to build a manufacturing plant in the United States for offshore wind cable production, citing insufficient market demand. The decision was made prior to President Trump's inauguration and suspension of federal offshore wind leasing, with the company deciding not to proceed with the Brayton Point project in Somerset.

title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance following strong third-quarter performance with revenue exceeding €5 billion, up 9.2% year-on-year[4]. Growth was driven primarily by demand for high-voltage cables for underground, submarine, and overhead infrastructure, with the company now expecting full-year Ebitda between €2.375bn and €2.425bn[4].

title: Prysmian, Versalis Launch Chemical Recycling Chain for Plastic Cable Waste in Italy
summary: Prysmian and Versalis have established a strategic partnership to create a chemical recycling supply chain for end-of-life cable plastics in Italy[2]. The pilot project will begin in the second half of 2026 and will use Versalis's Hoop® technology to recover up to 60% of difficult-to-recycle XLPE insulation used in energy cables[2].
